3e6ea0d7-96fc-4b71-8b99-0d7af337fcb7.description: The earner of this badge has a basic understanding of general cleaning duties including: - selecting and setting up equipment and materials - cleaning wet and dry areas and associated equipment - maintaining and storing cleaning equipment and chemicals.

3157bfe2-0ff9-401b-be16-4f0b80075e24.description: The earner of this badge will have a basic understanding of some of the core concepts underpinning family violence. This course is recommended for people who may be interested in understanding more about family violence before going on to formal family violence training to develop skills that can be applied in a professional setting. The intention of the course is to provide learners with a basic understanding of some of the core concepts underpinning family violence.

dc4cc354-457d-49c1-a99d-62cebc677f01.description: The earner of this badge will have an introduction to trauma-informed principles and practice for people interested in a role within the community services sector. It aims to build awareness of trauma-informed principles and practice with a focus on introduction to concepts. It is not designed to provide understanding of the detailed knowledge and skills to provide trauma-informed care and support.

d21d8f2a-32a6-42d8-929d-f372e8591d09.description: The earner of this badge will understand that as a support worker, you will encounter many different people with differing needs from the community. You will need to know what your professional boundaries are, what you can and cannot do, and have an understanding around how to communicate and be respectful of each individual service user and their carers and family members.
d21d8f2a-32a6-42d8-929d-f372e8591d09.name: Professional boundaries and communication strategies in the community services sector

2ef27be6-842a-4243-8666-81a79f0067be.description: The earner of this badge has a basic understanding of how to maintain the quality of perishable supplies for food and beverage, commercial cookery and catering operations where perishable suplies are required to be stored in optimum conditions to minimise wastage and avoid food contamination. They have covered: Storing Supplies in Appropriate Conditions, Maintaining Perishable Supplies at Optimum Quality, Checking Perishable Supplies and Dispose of Spoilt Stock.

This unit is included in a wide range of certificate III and certificate IV’s in health.

ec464458-802d-4af2-be2a-0f3c407bab35.description: The earner of this badge will have learned the importance of culture, identity and how to help work in a culturally safe way in the community services sector. You will engage with culture and cultural awareness broadly and then explore culture and cultural safety when working with people from an Aboriginal and Torres Straight Islander community. This course will allow you to reflect on how you can better support and service our community.
